title: Roy Keane shuts down Jamie Carragher during Sky Sports coverage
text:
Roy Keane took no prisoners in the Sky studio on Sunday as he brutally shut down Jamie Carragher live on air during a debate on Manchester United.

The former United midfielder has just signed a contract to be a regular pundit for the broadcaster and didn't take long to deliver his first savage blow.

After Keane watched Liverpool's victory over Chelsea at Stamford Bridge, Carragher was discussing how United can take note of his former club's previous bids to win the title before Keane got stuck in.

Roy Keane he brutally shut down Jamie Carragher in the Sky Sports studio on Sunday

The former Manchester United midfielder has just signed a contract to be a regular pundit

Keane reminded Carragher he never won the Premier League while discussing Liverpool

Carragher was making a point that Luis Suarez's arrival on Merseyside transformed Liverpool from a sixth-place team to title contenders under Brendan Rodgers.

But Keane was in no mood to agree, saying: 'But Jamie you just said "almost won the title", you didn't win a title. We're talking about Manchester United here.'

Carragher then replied: 'Forget the league title, you (United) need to bridge the gap (to Manchester City and Liverpool) first so you need two or three players to do that. At the moment you're sixth or seventh'.

Keane hit back with: 'That's right. But Liverpool are still trying to bridge that gap because they haven't got up there and won a league title.'

Fans predictably loved the exchange and took to social media afterwards to voice their pleasure.

One viewer, @CavaniConda, was clearly a huge fan of the put down. They wrote: 'This is pure savagery'.

Clearly agreeing with the Irishman's view, @dawkins1122 added: 'Quality keane there!!'.

@venkateshkris14 also said: 'i genuinely feel sorry for carra :D'.

@brenward74 tweeted: 'Cold brutal reality is that Roy is right...yes LFC have made serious strides forward but they have still not won PL.. i say that as a LFC fan... need to push on an win...then talk...'.
description: After Keane watched Liverpool's victory over Chelsea at Stamford Bridge, Carragher was discussing his former club's previous bids to win the title before Keane got stuck in.
